results.title: The car body: materials and design
results.brief_description: Summary: three alternative materials to steel for car bodies are highlighted. fully functional cars which have been made in glass reinforced plastic, wood and plastic are shown and their designers justify the use of these materials. there is a discussion

results.title: The Campaign
results.creator_credit: Santo Cilauro, Debra Choate, ABC-TV (Australia) and Frontline Television Productions
results.brief_description: The Campaign is a surprising political documentary where the anatomy of a federal campaign has been laid bare: the logistics, the travelling, the locations, the surroundings and the schedule. For the full 35 days of the 1996 Federal Election campaign, Santo Cilauro and his video-camera followed the then Prime Minister Paul Keating, his entourage and the media pack, around Australia to give a revealing insight into the physical nature of campaigning for the nation’s highest office. An inside view of how our view is formed in an era where the election battle is fought with the 15 second grab, this two part program is a dynamic display of how the moment is manufactured. Covering 35 days, 150 journalists, 40,000km, 11 million voters and one man in the middle, The Campaign shows why people describe Australian elections like no other in the world.

results.title: The Calling
results.creator_credit: Lisa Chambers and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: Madeline O’Connor is the perfect student and one destined to be a nun (according to her mother and the Sisters around her at school). Madeline has other ideas however and dreams of being a ballerina. She does everything in her power to misbehave and ward off any potential angels that might be tempted to come to her during the night - thus signalling she has been chosen by god. This is an uplifting comedy about ambition and fate.

results.title: The Cabin Kids in Pink lemonade
results.creator_credit: Al Christie and Educational Films Corp of America
results.brief_description: Five Afro-American children of varying ages known as the Cabin Kids find they haven’t enough money to get into the circus. They decide to follow a dog under the side canvas but unfortunately are spotted by the police. However, Toto the Clown comes to their rescue only on the proviso that if the Cabin Kids entertain him, he will entertain them. The Kids sing in fine unison - and the clowns put on an impromptu act in return. Story by Al jarrett. Photography by George Webber.

results.title: The Byzantine Empire
results.brief_description: The Byzantine Empire had become, by 750 AD, the richest and most powerful in the world. This film presents a brief historical outline of the Empire, and indicates its important cultural contributions in art, religion and scholarship. Photographed principally in Greece and Turkey, the film captures the richness of the mosaic works, icons and architecture. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Buzz of rock and roll
results.creator_credit: Dale Lynch and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Documentary about three Australian musicians who are also tinnitus sufferers- Fiona Horne (DefFX), Rod Ling (July Fourteenth) and Richard Pleasance (Boom Crash Opera). Tinnitus is a condition that causes ringing in the ears and affects one in five people.

results.title: The Butler
results.creator_credit: Anna Kannava, John Cruthers and Huzzah Productions
results.brief_description: An intimate portrait of a Greek family and their experience of migration and integration into Australian life. Nino, the youngest, is the vehicle used to explore the alienation and shock that are part of migration, the complexity of family relationships and the integration of the intellectually disabled into the community. “The Butler” is the sequel to “Ten years after, ten years older” also held in the collection.

results.title: The Business of newspapers
results.brief_description: A comprehensive film examining the past present and future of the newspaper business. Issues covered include the influence of big businesses on journalism, the crisis of the survival of small-town newspapers, and how a newspaper’s editorial policies are being dictated by economic consideration. NB: The information in this film is very relevant to Australian media ownership in the 90’s.

results.title: The Bush myth
results.brief_description: This documentary is an examination of the way the bush myth has been portrayed in such Australian films as “The Sentimental Bloke”, “Sons of Matthew”, “Sunday too far away”, and “Picnic at Hanging Rock”. It covers the use of the bush motif throughout Australian history and how the interpretations and reactions to the landscape have changed so rapidly. It studies how the theme of nature versus culture has goverened almost all film making depicting the Australian bush until approximately 1982.
